body: Air vehicles fly through the air. They are usually propelled by air currents, alchemical engines, magic, or in the case of larger air vehicles, a mix of air currents and alchemical engines or magic. Airships, because of their nature, travel though all three dimensions instead of two. When they ascend, they must do so at half their current speed. When air vehicles descend, they can (but do not have to) move at double their current speed. After the ascent or descent, treat the vehicle's current speed as it was before making the ascent or descent.
name: Air Vehicles

sections.propulsion: current (air; 90 squares of dirigible, hp 450) and magic
sections.weapons: Up to 6 Large direct-fire siege engines in banks of 3 positioned on the port and starboard sides of the airship, or up to 4 Huge direct-fire siege engines in banks of two on the port and starboard sides of the ship. The siege engines may only fire out the sides of the ship they are positioned on. They cannot be swiveled to fire toward the forward or aft sides of the ship.
sections.driving_space: the nine squares around the controlling magic item that sits at the front of the ship
sections.name: Airship

sections.propulsion: alchemical (6 squares of alchemical engines in the middle of the ship; hardness 8, hp 120)
sections.weapons: Up to 6 Large direct-fire siege engines in banks of 3 positioned on the port and starboard sides of the alchemical dragon, or up to 4 Huge direct-fire siege engines in banks of two on the port and starboard sides of the ship. The siege engines may only fire out the sides of the ship they are positioned on. They cannot be swiveled to fire toward the forward or aft sides of the ship.
sections.driving_space: the nine squares around the steering wheel that sits at the front of the ship
sections.name: Alchemical Dragon
sections.driving_check: Craft (alchemy) or Knowledge (arcana) +10 to the DC

sections.acceleration: 10 ft. (30 ft. when it first pushes off)
sections.driving_check: Fly or Acrobatics +10 to the DC
sections.propulsion: current (air; four squares of sail, which serve as the majority of the vehicle, hp 20)
sections.name: Glider
sections.hardness: 0 (takes double damage from acid and fire attacks)
